title: How to Program a WOW! Universal Remote: Complete Setup Guide

steps.title: Turn on the device you want to program.
steps.content: Turn on the device you want to program. For example, if you want to control your TV with your WOW remote, turn on your TV.

steps.title: Press the correct device button while pointing the remote at the device.
steps.content: Press the correct device button while pointing the remote at the device. For example, if programming the remote with your television, press the “TV” button. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold SETUP until the device button blinks twice.
steps.content: Press and hold SETUP until the device button blinks twice. After the second blink, you can release the button.

steps.title: Find the code for the device you want to program.
steps.content: Find the code for the device you want to program. You can find the full list in this reference guide .

steps.title: Enter the programming code and press the POWER key.
steps.content: Enter the programming code and press the POWER key. The device will power off when the correct programming code has been entered.

steps.title: Search for a code (optional).
steps.content: Search for a code (optional). If you cannot find a code for your device, you can search for the code using your WOW remote. Here's how: Turn on the device you want to program. With the remote aimed at the device, press the device button (for example, TV ). Press and hold the SETUP button until the device button blinks twice. Enter 991 . The device key will blink twice again. Aim the remote at the device and press PWR once. Press and release CH+ repeatedly. This searches through the available codes. Once the code is found, the device will turn off. Press PWR to turn the device back on using your WOW remote. Press SETUP once to lock in the code. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat for all devices you want to program with your WOW remote.
steps.content: Repeat for all devices you want to program with your WOW remote.

steps.title: Turn on the device you want to program.
steps.content: Turn on the device you want to program. Ensure the device is plugged in and powered on.

steps.title: Press and hold the MENU and OK buttons at the same time.
steps.content: Press and hold the MENU and OK buttons at the same time. Continue holding down these buttons until the POWER key blinks two times. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Enter 991.
steps.content: Enter 9 9 1 . This puts the remote into programming mode.

steps.title: Enter 1 to search for TV codes, or 3 for audio devices.
steps.content: Enter 1 to search for TV codes, or 3 for audio devices. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Point the remote at the device and press NAV UP.
steps.content: Point the remote at the device and press NAV UP. Keep doing this until you find the correct code. When the WOW remote finds the correct code, it will turn the device off. Stop pressing NAV UP when this happens.

steps.title: Press the OK button to save the code.
steps.content: Press the OK button to save the code. The POWER key will blink two times to indicate the remote is now programmed for the selected device.

steps.title: Repeat for all devices you want to program with your WOW remote.
steps.content: Repeat for all devices you want to program with your WOW remote.

steps.title: Turn on the device you want to program.
steps.content: Turn on the device you want to program. Ensure the device is plugged in and powered on.

steps.title: Point the remote at your device and press the A or B button.
steps.content: Point the remote at your device and press the A or B button. If you're programming your WOW remote for a TV, press A for TV setup. If you're programming it for an audio device, press B . [5] X Research source

steps.title: Point the remote at your device and hold down the OK button.
steps.content: Point the remote at your device and hold down the OK button. Continue holding down the button to allow the remote to scan for codes. Alternatively, if you have the code for the device you're programming, press and hold the OK and MUTE keys at the same time until "Power" blinks twice, then enter the code. To find a list of device codes, check out this reference guide .

steps.title: Release the OK button when the device turns off.
steps.content: Release the OK button when the device turns off. When the WOW remote finds the correct code, it will turn off the device. You can now use your WOW remote to turn it back on and control the device.

steps.title: Repeat for all devices you want to program with your WOW remote.
steps.content: Repeat for all devices you want to program with your WOW remote.

steps.title: Turn on the device you want to program.
steps.content: Turn on the device you want to program. Ensure the device is plugged in and powered on. Your WOW remote is already programmed for your set-top box. However, you can use this guide to program the remote to turn your TV on and off.

steps.title: Press the TV button on your remote.
steps.content: Press the TV button on your remote. The button will blink one time.

steps.title: Press and hold the SETUP button.
steps.content: Press and hold the SETUP button. When the button blinks twice, release it. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Enter the programming code for your device.
steps.content: Enter the programming code for your device. You can find a list of programming codes in this reference guide . As long as you have entered the code correctly, you can now begin using your WOW remote to control the selected TV.

steps.title: Do a code search if this doesn't work.
steps.content: Do a code search if this doesn't work. If you can't find a code for your device or the code is not accepted, you can do a code search. Here's how: Turn on the TV you want to program. With the remote aimed at the device, press the TV button. Press and hold the SETUP button until the TV button blinks twice. Enter 991 . The device key will blink twice again. Aim the remote at the device and press PWR once. Press and release CH+ repeatedly. This searches through the available codes. Once the code is found, the TV will turn off. Press PWR to turn the TV back on using your WOW remote. Press SETUP once to lock in the code.

steps.title: Repeat for all devices you want to program with your WOW remote.
steps.content: Repeat for all devices you want to program with your WOW remote.

steps.title: Try replacing the batteries in your remote.
steps.content: Try replacing the batteries in your remote. According to Cathey, if the remote is not working at all, try a fresh set of batteries. Even if it lights up, weak batteries can prevent your remote from responding to some or all button commands.

steps.title: Try unplugging and reconnecting your device.
steps.content: Try unplugging and reconnecting your device. If the device you're programming fails to respond after being programmed with your WOW remote, a power cycle could help resolve problems with unresponsiveness.

steps.title: Move objects obstructing the signal between your device and the remote.
steps.content: Move objects obstructing the signal between your device and the remote. Large objects between the device and your remote, such as furniture, can sometimes prevent both devices from communicating.

steps.title: Make sure that your device is plugged in and can be powered on manually.
steps.content: Make sure that your device is plugged in and can be powered on manually.
